conclusion: To determine how the shadows (A, B, C, and D) will change when the light source moves to the back right, we need to consider the following factors:

premise: When the light source moves to the back right, the shadows will shift towards the front left.
conclusion: This is because shadows are cast in the direction opposite to the light source.

premise: The size of the shadows will increase.
conclusion: This is because as the light source moves further away from the objects (towards the back right), the angle of the light rays relative to the objects becomes more acute, causing the shadows to stretch out more.
